settings.name: Horizontal Flip
settings.info: This setting does not rotate the camera feed but actually flips the image like a mirror in the horizontal or vertical plane.
settings.warning: Camera feed will need to be restarted for this setting to be applied.
settings.label: Original/Flipped

settings.name: Exposure Compensation
settings.info: Exposure compensation value in 'stops', which adjusts the target of the AEC/AGC algorithm. Positive values increase the target brightness, and negative values decrease it. Zero represents the base or 'normal' exposure level.
settings.label: Original/Flipped

settings.name: Exposure Time
settings.info: Exposure time for the sensor to use, measured in microseconds.
settings.label: Value in microseconds

settings.name: Analogue Gain
settings.info: Analogue gain applied by the sensor
settings.label: Original/Flipped

settings.name: Enable Changes to AEC/AGC algorithm
settings.info: Allow the Auto Exposure Compensation and Auto Gain Compensation (AEC/AGC) algorithm to be turned on and off. When if is off, there will be no automatic updates to the cameraâ€™s gain or exposure settings.
settings.label: Disabled/Enabled

childsettings.name: AE Constraint Mode
childsettings.info: Sets the constraint mode of the AEC/AGC algorithm.
childsettings.warning: Shadows and Custom are currently disabled and requires a file to work and that feature is not in the webUI

childsettings.name: AE Exposure Mode
childsettings.info: Sets the exposure mode of the AEC/AGC algorithm
childsettings.warning: Custom is currently disabled and requires a file to work and that feature is not in the webUI

childsettings.name: AE Metering Mode
childsettings.info: Sets the metering mode of the AEC/AGC algorithm.
childsettings.warning: Custom is currently disabled and requires a file to work and that feature is not in the webUI

settings.name: AE Flicker Mode
settings.info: Sets the flicker avoidance mode of the AEC/AGC algorithm.
settings.label: Off/Manual

childsettings.name: AE Flicker Period
childsettings.info: The period of the lighting cycle in microseconds. For example, for 50Hz mains lighting the flicker occurs at 100Hz, so the period would be 10000 microseconds.
childsettings.label: Value in microseconds

settings.name: Enable Auto White Balance algorithm
settings.info: Turn the auto white balance (AWB) algorithm on or off. When it is off, there will be no automatic updates to the colour gains. Auto: Automatically sets white balance and keeps adjusting
settings.warning: Custom is currently disabled and requires a file to work and that feature is not in the webUI
settings.label: Disabled/Enabled

settings.name: Brightness
settings.info: Adjusts the image brightness where -1.0 is very dark, 1.0 is very bright, and 0.0 is the default 'normal' brightness.

settings.name: Contrast
settings.info: Sets the contrast of the image, where zero means 'no contrast', 1.0 is the default 'normal' contrast, and larger values increase the contrast proportionately

settings.name: Saturation
settings.info: Amount of colour saturation, where zero produces greyscale images, 1.0 represents default 'normal' saturation, and higher values produce more saturated colours.

settings.name: Sharpness
settings.info: Sets the image sharpness, where zero implies no additional sharpening is performed, 1.0 is the default 'normal' level of sharpening, and larger values apply proportionately stronger sharpening.
